result.execSummary:
The defendant Mark V Schaller was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Ozaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: Court costs due during term of probation. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, in addition to all other enforcement sanctions available to the court, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.
Defendant is granted privileges set forth in Wis Stats 303.08

-AODA with counseling/treatment as recommended.
-No controlled substances or prescription medication unless prescribed by physician and in conformity with said prescription.
-Random tests.

timeConds.notes: Court authorizes transfer to Milwaukee County, if accepted.

Defendant Mark V Schaller in court with attorney Stephen Michael Govin.  Adam Y. Gerol appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant enters guilty plea to Ct. 1. Court examines defendant, finds him guilty and renders sentence. On motion of the State, Ct. 2 dismissed and readin.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 10, 2014 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Mark V Schaller in court with attorney Stephen Michael Govin.  Adam Yale Gerol appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense requests adjournment.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 10, 2014 at 01:15 pm.

Further proceedings on October 7, 2014 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Mark V Schaller in court with attorney Stephen Michael Govin.  Patti L. Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing waived.  Court finds probable cause and orders matter bound over for arraignment. Information filed.   Information read, defendant advised of penalties, further reading waived. Plea of not guilty entered.  Further proceedings scheduled for October 7, 2014 at 01:15 pm.
Status conference on August 11, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Mark V Schaller in court with attorney Stephen Michael Govin.  Patti L. Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court orders adjournment, allowing time for defendant to decide whether preliminary hearing will be requested.  Time limits waived for preliminary hearing on felony complaint.  Status conference scheduled for August 11, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on July 23, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Mark V Schaller in court.  Jeffrey A. Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Def has appointment to seek counsel. Court grants last adjournment for status on prelim.  Status conference scheduled for July 23, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on July 14, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Mark V Schaller in court.  Patti L Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court finds good cause to extend time limits for holding preliminary hearing.  Status conference scheduled for July 14, 2014 at 08:30 am.

State by ADA Patti Wabitsch.  Defendant in custody & appearing by video conferencing from the Ozaukee County Jail and by Atty Dejunco as a friend to the Court.  Counsel advises has not met with the defendant.  Counsel advises defendant turned self in on warrant.  Court examines defendant on right to counsel.  Defendant will be requesting time to retain counsel.  State requesting reinstatement of signature bond.  Court orders $250 signature bond w/condition: no controlled subst/prescrip medic unless prescribed.  Court orders matter adj to 6/3 at 8:30 am for status of preliminary hearing in B2.  This Court will not address the issue of reinstatement of previous signature bond - to be addressed with Branch 2 Court.
Per Dispatch, subject is in custody on warrant

Defendant Mark V Schaller not in court. Jeffrey A Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court finds probable cause.  Upon defendant's failure to appear, court orders warrant to issue. Forfeit any bail.
W/CONDITION:   No controlled substance or prescription medication unless prescribed by physician and in conformity with said prescription.
Status hearing on May 12, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Branch 1 hearing bail hearing only for Branch 2. Defendant Mark V Schaller in court with attorney Wilfred P de Junco.  Defendant in custody. Jeffrey A Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court advises defendant of complaint/penalties thereof. Defendant will retain private counsel, not eligible for the public defender. Court finds good cause to extend timelimits.  Court orders $500 bond w/condition no controlled substances or prescription medication unless prescribed by physician and in conformity with said prescription.  Status hearing scheduled for May 12, 2014 at 08:30 am.
